title: site should call project "Lucene Java", not just "Lucene"
description: To avoid confusion with the top-level Lucene project, the Lucene Java website should refer to itself as Lucene Java.

comments.content:
Here's a patch that replaces "Apache Lucene" with "Apache Lucene Java" in the website.  It also fixes the breadcrumbs at the top of the web pages and the links on the logos.

Is "Apache Lucene Java" too verbose?  Should we instead just use "Lucene Java"?
comments.author: Doug Cutting

comments.content:
I'm actually more confused when I see Lucene Java than I am by Lucene  

But, I'll commit this soon if no one has any objections.
comments.author: Mark Miller

comments.content: updated patch that also includes doc site level changes
comments.author: Mark Miller

comments.content:
AFAICT, this was committed long ago.

These site pages were changed from "Lucene Java" to "Lucene Core" by Grant Ingersoll for the Lucene 3.1 release in March 2010.
comments.author: Steve Rowe
